content: while browsing around, I've noticed that NFA.pumping_lemma bounds the minimum length of the string as $2^{|\sigma|}$, while $|\sigma|$ is the optimal bound. would it make sense for me to work on an improved proof for this?
Looks like a fine thing to work on to me!

So, looks like I'd want to use something like the IsPath API that's currently available for \epsNFA, but not NFA itself. Mirroring the API here would be desirable, right? I can imagine some ways I could be trying to avoid doing that by proving the pumping lemma for eps-NFAs and then transferring back to normal NFAs (in the opposite direction to what the import hierarchy is doing), but that's not a good idea, is it?
